I was not able to reproduce this in 3.3.1 yet.  It looks like this happens
because we did not yet apply the patch from bug 200558.  I am still
investigating though.

I will address this in the 3.4 stream as soon as I am sure about whether it
affects 3.3.1 or not.

This is really strange and is not possible to happen when you we look at the current CVS-HEAD state of ViewerColumn. When we first discovered this problem when we released the fix for bug #201905 to HEAD > 20070831 and encountered exactly this kind of failure we (Eric, Kim and me) decided to remove the test from the test-suite and simply comment the call to ColumnViewer#clearLegacyEditingSetup() in ViewerColumn in HEAD and rollback the change in 3.3.1 => In 3.4 no code is calling this method at the moment!

Because CVS-HEAD shows this state since 2007-08-31 (check in from Eric in HEAD) there has to be a problem with the submission used to create the build I20070911-0833.

Because of the Widget-Disposed problem we have been running into we completely reworked the fix for 3.3.1 to be dipose-safe. Porting the patch from 3.3.1 to 3.4 should do the trick.

I got this trace when starting a refactoring tests. And I did this by starting it from the workspace. So there's a possibility that I have my setup messed up and not all plug-ins were I20070911.

If you checked that clearLegacyEditingSetup is never called, I suggest to close this bug and wait if it shows up again.
I never seen this on 3.3.1.
